conversation.content: Good afternoon. I recently enrolled in your Premier Health Plan and I'd like to clarify what services are covered.
Good afternoon and thank you for calling. I'd be happy to review your Premier Health Plan coverage, policy number PHP-2024-88734. Let me pull up your account details right now.
Excellent, thank you. I'm particularly concerned about specialist visits and whether I need referrals.

I can confirm that your Premier Health Plan includes specialist coverage with a $40 copay per visit. You do not need referrals for in-network specialists, which gives you direct access to care when needed.
That's reassuring to hear. What about diagnostic procedures like MRIs or CT scans?

Certainly. Advanced imaging procedures including MRIs, CT scans, and PET scans are covered after you meet your $500 annual deductible. You'll then pay 20% coinsurance, with your maximum out-of-pocket capped at $3,500 per year.
I appreciate the clarity. Are preventive screenings handled differently from diagnostic procedures?

Absolutely, they are handled quite differently. Preventive screenings such as mammograms, colonoscopies, and annual wellness exams are covered at 100% with no deductible required when you use in-network providers.
Perfect. Could you explain how prescription coverage works under this plan?
Of course.
And are there different tiers for medications?

Yes, your prescription benefit uses a four-tier formulary system. Tier 1 generic medications have a $10 copay, Tier 2 preferred brand names are $35, Tier 3 non-preferred brands are $75, and Tier 4 specialty drugs require 30% coinsurance up to $250 per prescription.
That's helpful. What about mental health services and therapy sessions?

Mental health services are covered equally to medical services under your plan. Individual therapy sessions have a $40 copay, matching specialist visits, and you have unlimited annual visits when using network providers, case number MH-77901 for reference.
Excellent coverage. Is emergency room care covered if I'm traveling out of state?

Emergency room visits are covered nationwide and internationally at in-network rates. You'll pay a $350 copay per visit, which is waived if you're admitted to the hospital within 24 hours of the emergency room visit.
That's very comprehensive. How do I find in-network providers in my area?

You can access our provider directory through your member portal at premierhealthnetwork.com using your member ID PHP88734001. Alternatively, I can email you a direct link to search providers by specialty and location within your ZIP code area.
Please send that link. One final question about dental and vision coverage.

I'll send that link immediately to your registered email. Your current Premier Health Plan doesn't include dental or vision coverage, but we offer supplemental plans starting at $18.50 monthly for dental and $12.75 for vision that integrate seamlessly with your existing benefits.

scenario: trying to understand their coverage and what's included
